title: Amazing architecture and history
text: We enjoyed our experience on the Acropolis. We hired a private guide who did a wonderful job explaining the history of the place. Without the guide our experience wouldn't have been as rich. We paid about 200 euros for a half day private tour for 2 of us. On the face kind of expensive but we felt it a good value.

title: Beautiful for an evening stroll
text: We stayed in Plaka and were only a short distance from the main tourist street. It was full of tourists but also full of shops and restaurants. Every evening we walked from one end to the other enjoying the sights. We also explored several of the side streets that are not busy at all.

title: This is a large site worth a few hours of exploring
text: We spent a few hours walking around the site. It is a large site and many ruins to see. It was a rainy day when we went and was not hot. There were not too many people there either. This was early in the afternoon. We purchased tickets as part of a package through the Ministry of Culture and Sports web site. For 30 euros we got a 5 day pass for several of the sites. If you plan to see them all you can save money and time by purchasing this pass ahead of time online.

title: Seaside table, good food and fun waiter
text: We had lunch here. The fish was good. We had a great conversation with the waiter. Three feet from the water and entertained by a man snorkeling to fix a boat right in front of us

title: spectacular views of Bol and the Adriatic Sea
text: It's a long drive to get there but the views were amazing. The concession stand was closed because we were there out of season. Be prepared for a windy experience as you are on the highest point in the Adriatics.

title: Unique beach in a beautiful setting
text: We visited in early October so most of the tourists were long gone. There were some people but it definitely was not crowded. We did go swimming although the water was pretty brisk. We enjoyed watching some men kite board. We had a car and there is parking close to the beach for a small fee.

title: Lots to explore in the old town
text: We enjoyed a day of walking about the old town. There are busy areas and streets that are packed with tourists but also many pretty little side streets that are all peace and quiet. We paid the 200 kuna fee to walk on the top of the wall which has incredible views

title: Great views of the sea
text: The doorway in the city wall gives no clue to what is beyond. You step in and go down a couple steps and turn right. All of a sudden you are outside the city wall at a little bar on the cliffs. People were swimming below. Boat and kayaks went by the whole time we were there. Waitstaff was fun. We asked it they took credit cards and he said yes and mentioned that they also took gold and diamonds.

title: Fun to meander our way through the little streets
text: We stayed inside the walls of the old city. It was fun to walk around to see the many old buildings and the fun shops. The Turkish rug shop was our favorite. Lots of tourists when the cruise ships come in.

title: Beautiful setting, gorgeous views
text: We spent 2 days in and around the Bay of Kotor. Scenery was perfect. As I looked at the mountains and sky it almost looked like the painted backdrop of a movie set.

title: very fun BBQ place
text: A wide variety of grilled meats. We ordered a variety meat platter. Not exactly sure what it all was but everything was tasty. Help yourself to the beverages in the cooler. Fun experience and great food.

title: Great location, great food, great service
text: We didn't have a reservation so had to wait an hour but it was worth it. Grilled octopus was cooked perfectly. The waiter took great care of us. Cheesecake with passion fruit topping was a perfect finish to the meal.

title: Beautiful square with lots of evening activity
text: We were in the square both during the day and at night. It is a beautiful place at night. Full of people and activity. The buildings surrounding the square are all lit up. Merry go round to ride. Street musicians.

title: Great restaurant with traditional Albanian fare
text: We went to this restaurant on the recommendation of our Airbnb host. It did not disappoint. The sausages were tasty as were the other things we tried. The waiter was super friendly and helpful.

title: We just had coffee but a good experience
text: We were in need of a cup of coffee and were running some errands in the old Skopje mall when we stumbled on this place. Cuban themed restaurant in North Macedonia. We thought it strange but may be unaware of some historical connection.

title: The fortress is impressive
text: The fortress is impressive as is any large stone structure built without modern machinery. The site however was pretty run down and dirty. Free to get in so definitely worth a little time to walk around.

title: Beautiful city square
text: We enjoyed lunch from a local take away place while sitting in the square. A great people watching place and the fountains are very pretty especially at night

title: Not quite what we expected but enjoyed it
text: We were expecting a bit more of an older bazaar but in reality it was mostly new shops selling clothing and jewelry. We still really enjoyed walking around and seeing all the sights. There are remnants of the old Turkish trading days.

title: Wouldn't normally go to Burger King while in Europe but...
text: It was the most handy place to get a cup of coffee the day we were leaving the city. Good cup of coffee and help staff

title: Beautiful bridge connecting the city
text: The bridge is a beautiful extension of the public square on the south side of the river. It leads to the Turkish bazaar on the north side.

title: You'll wait in line to rub Aristotle's toe
text: Silly superstition to rub Aristotle's toe to increase your wisdom. Had to wait in line to get my chance. Not sure I am any wiser for having done so but was fun anyway.

title: Very majestic
text: In a park near the sea. This statue is very majestic. Nearby are other sculptures relating to Alexander the Great.

title: Beautiful setting and great food
text: We had a lovely meal at Frutti di Mare. The mussels were very good. They also serve fresh made bread which is great dipped in olive oil. The waitstaff was good and we received complimentary dessert.

title: Nice place in Plaka
text: Outside dining on the main tourist avenue in Plaka. Traditional Greek fare with a nice wait staff. The guide we hired to take us to the Acropolis recommended this restaurant.

title: Fun watching the chefs prepare the meals
text: This is a busy place and we neglected to make reservations. We ended up sitting at the bar, which is really across from the kitchen. It was fun watching the chefs prepare various meals. They were having a good time which was enjoyable to watch. We had walked quite a ways to get there and the staff was kind enough to call a taxi for us to take back to our AirBnb.

title: Fun Christmas show
text: The biggest show business family in the world. Fun Christmas show for all ages. This is a very talented family. Great singers and musicians. Make sure to see this show when you are in Branson.

title: Great Christmas show
text: We attended the Brett family Christmas show. Excellent singing, dancing and message of Christmas. A must see when in Branson

title: Nice Italian food
text: This is our second trip to Florentina’s. The food is good. The service was courteous and prompt. I had the combo of 3 Italian favorites: lasagna, chicken parmigiana and fettuccine Alfredo. Chianti wine was also nice. We will eat there again when we are in Branson.

title: Fun Christmas Show
text: This is a family friendly show that features many magical illusions and great singing. This is my second time seeing this show. Definitely recommend it if you are visiting Branson.

title: Nice place for lunch
text: A new lunch place for me. I had the lunch burrito with shredded beef and all the fixin’s. It was more than plenty for lunch. The waitstaff was friendly and helpful.

title: Nice Salad for lunch
text: I met a colleague for lunch at the Orchid. The waitstaff was friendly, helpful and prompt. We sat on the outside patio. The food was delivered quickly and was very tasty. I had a oriental chicken salad. Overall a great experience and I would go there again.

title: Convenient way to get around Amsterdam
text: We arrived in Amsterdam via the airport then took a train to a train station near where we were staying. From there we were told to take the #17 tram for a few stops. It was a bit of a challenge locating the ticketing machine and understanding the instructions but we ended up purchasing a 1 hour ticket. This allowed us to get on and off any tram for 1 hour. Once on the tram we realized you can purchase tickets on the tram from a person. The next time we got on the tram we purchased 48 hour passes which allowed us to ride the tram whenever we wanted for 2 days, For 2 of us if was about 25 euros. We used it a lot and would recommend y it as an easy way to cover larger distances in Amsterdam.

title: Fun and fast paced chocolate purchasing!!!
text: I had found an article listing the 5 best chocolate shops in Brussels. With so many to choose from I'm not sure how they decided but we were on a quest to go to all of them. That led us to Passion chocolate. A small shop off the beaten track. The young lady who waited on us was very helpful. She explained how the different mixed chocolate boxes were priced and how many pieces you'd get. Then she helped us choose our chocolate. Instead of letting us ponder over our choices she asked us if we liked something or not and if we said yes...in the box that one would go. It was a fun experience and the chocolate was excellent.

title: Fun place to try a Belgian waffle
text: Maison Dandoy was recommended to us as a great place to have a Belgian waffle. There are so many to choose from but Dandoy did not disappoint. We got there early, right as they were opening up their upstairs seating area. We got a great table with the window open overlooking the street below. We had the leige waffle which is more dense. Mine was covered in whipped cream and strawberries and my wife's with cherries and nuts. Delicious! The wait staff was prompt and friendly. In fact, we were walking by the shop later in the evening when they were closing and he saw us, smiled and said hello. Again, there are lots of waffles places to choose from but this is a winner. Just go early if you want a great seat.

title: Great place to rent a bike
text: A-Bike was conveniently located near Vondelpark where we wanted to ride. They made the rental experience seamless and made sure our bikes were adjusted properly. We paid about 18 euros for 1 1/2 hours of riding. Nice value and great service.

title: Fun selection of chocolates
text: I had read an article about the best chocolate shops in Brussels and Frederic Blondeel was on the list. We enjoyed the selection process and soon a great box of chocolates to bring home. The staff was helpful in the selection process. There are so many kinds of chocolate to choose from. Definitely worth the visit.

title: Great way to see the city of Amsterdam
text: We took the open boat tour. Our captain Stephan was funny, engaging and able to answer many questions. It was fun to learn the history of Amsterdam and see the architecture from a different perspective. It was a bit confusing going from the ticket office to the place where you get on the boat. Apparently there are 2 places you can get on the boat and the ticket agent gave us tickets for the wrong location. The staff at the boat were helpful and let us board anyway. It was good that the tour was not fully booked. The boarding area has more than 1 company leaving from that area so it's somewhat of a guessing game as to where you're supposed to go. Look for the employees with the logo on it and your'll be finr.

title: Love flying into/out of small airports
text: Flights were good. Nothing out of the ordinary. The Springfield airport was a fun experience as the security screening was completely shut down while the TSA agents were in training.

title: Disappointing and not what I expected
text: The Bloemenmarkt was on my list of things to do while in Amsterdam. I was expecting actual flowers in the floating market. Instead we were greeted with stall after stall of trinkets and souvenirs with almost no real flowers. We still enjoyed our stroll through the area although it was packed with tourists.

title: Interesting overview of cheese in the Netherlands
text: Quirky. This museum is in the basement of a cheese shop. It gives a nice overview of cheese in the Netherlands as well as the farmers who produce the cheese. Pretty steep steps to get to the museum. It was fun to visit.

title: Great new culinary experience!
text: Our hosts suggested that we eat at Kartika. Going back hundreds of years Dutch traders exploring the world brought back exotic spices from the Spice Islands (Indonesia). Ever since there has been a connection between the Netherlands and Indonesia. The proprietor doesn't speak English very well so we had a hard time getting seated but he was very warm and friendly. You are given 2 options when you enter: traditional or vegetarian. We chose the traditional. The waiter then brings a small buffet of items to your table so you get to sample many different dishes. As expected, we liked some better than others but all were great to try. Fun experience!!! Would definitely go back when in Amsterdam again.

title: First chocolate store experience in Brussles
text: This store was on a list of the best chocolate stores in Brussels and it did not disappoint. The young lady working behind the counter was helpful in answering all our questions and assisted us in filling up a nice box of chocolates. The chocolate was very tasty. The shop is very near the Grand Place.

title: Fun filled, energetic central square
text: We passed through Grand Place many times while we were in Brussels. Early in the morning it was quiet with only a few people. Then in the afternoon and evening it was filled with people taking selfies with the beautiful buildings in the background. Crowds gathered around street performers. The architecture is beautiful.

title: Great place for an afternoon stroll
text: We took an afternoon stroll through Parc du Cinquantenaire. It was a peaceful place yet full of activity. People playing with their dogs and playing games. We watched 2 young men practicing some sort of martial arts and a little boy, no older than 2, was mimicking their moves. so cute. The Arc is interesting to study, especially the 8 statues (4 on each side). Then we sat on a bench and watched children play in a large fountain. Finally, we got an ice cream cone and strolled back to the city.

title: Disappointing Service
text: The pizza was good but the staff was rude and seemed uninterested in having us there. We had the pricipessa pizza. We would not go back here.

title: Authentic Dutch food
text: We were staying at a B&B about 1 1/2 miles from Lekkererk. We walked to the town in hopes of finding something to eat. We came across Huisje van de Zeeuw. As we were seated the waitress apologized that they did not have a menu in English only Dutch. We told her it was ok and that we would figure it out with her help. They offered a 3 course meal with several selections in each course. Everything we had was excellent and she provided great service. When it was time to pay I asked if they took a Visa credit card and she did not know. So I opted to pay cash. A great place to get authentic Dutch food and there were no tourists only locals in the restaurant.

title: Nice shop near Grand Place
text: We stopped here because we saw the macaroons in the window. It was hard to pick only 6 and they were very tasty. We also got some other candies. The most unique thing we saw were chocolate tools. They had crafted various hand tools out of chocolate and had dusted them with cocoa to make them look rusty. We would have purchased one but figured it would not survive our travels intact.
place: La Belgique Gourmande - Galerie de la Reine

title: Thought I was in a fine jewelry store
text: Pierre Marcolini was on a list of the best chocolate shops in Brussels. It felt more like a fine jewelry store than a chocolate shop. The environment made it feel like you were in a special place and could get special chocolate there. The staff took time to explain their chocolate especially their limited edition chocolates. We ended up purchasing 2 of the limited edition ones. We haven't eaten them yet but are excited to try them.

title: Interesting Experience
text: As we walked along the street all the restaurants were hawking to get people to stop. I wanted some mussels so we stopped here. The wait staff was friendly and engaged. They brought some bread and it tasted like it had been cut quite a while ago so not real fresh. We selected our main dishes. Then the waiter said, "what would you like for an appetizer?" The way he asked I assumed (My fault) that it was included in the price of the meal. It wasn't. The food was good but nothing special. The waiter brought is coffee and said it was on the house. We enjoyed watching them try to get other people to eat there. Not sure I'd go back there but we had a fun experience. It's all an adventure!!!!

title: Fun way to see Frankfurt
text: We rode on the 50 minute Frankfurt sightseeing cruise. The scenery was great. The narration was in German and English and highlighted the landmarks along the way. We would have taken the 100 minute tour but didn't get there in time and missed that last one of the day.

title: Fun central square
text: We stollled through the square in the evening. We were able to have an ice cream cone and sit to listen to some street performers playing the accordian and violin. They even played my request for the theme from "The Godfather"

title: Amusing
text: One of my must do things in Brussels. Yes he is little. No it isn't spectacular. Yes it is quirky. Plays to our sophomoric nature. Definitely worth the short walk to see the little guy!!!

title: Great way to see Amsterdam
text: We really enjoyed our small boat canal cruise. The captain Stephan was energetic, informational and funny. He was very willing to answer questions and pointed out many unique characteristics of Amsterdam and its buildings. I would recommend this cruise.
place: Amsterdam Small-Group Canal Cruise with Drinks
placeLocation: Koog aan de Zaan, The Netherlands

title: Fun place for a leisure bike ride
text: Initially we were going to rent bikes and tour Amsterdam, but after seeing the pace of the riders we decided against that. Instead we rented bikes and made a few laps around Vondelpark. It's a beautiful place and was full of all types of activities and people. We were able to ride our bikes at a pace that suited us without causing issues for other bikers.

title: Beautiful architechture
text: We flew into Amsterdam but left by train from the central station. It was easy to get to and also easy to purchase tickets.

title: Great place for a leisurely stroll
text: We spent most of a day walking around the canal ring. Exploring the architecture, looking in shop windows and taking in the canal scenes from the many bridges.

title: Great last German meal before heading home
text: Nice airport restaurant. We had Frankfurters (what else!!!) and some other sausages. The service was good and the food very tasty. Like everything at the airport it's a bit overpriced, but what else can you do. Definitely stop by if you have a layover in Frankfurt.

title: Great German food a little off the beaten tourist path
text: We had a lovely German meal at the Klosterhof. It seemed like most of the patrons were locals not tourists. My wife had bratwurst and I had schnitzel with apples, bacon, cheese and a fried egg on top. Very tasty. We laughed when we saw the bottle of water we ordered was more expensive than the big glass of beer I had. Gotta love a place where beer is cheaper than water!!!

title: Fun to see the craftsmanship and learn of the history
text: We toured the Royal Delft workshop and museum. The tour starts with a couple short videos. Then you take a self guided tour of the museum with a device that tells about the particular area of the museum (17 in all). Ours was in English but there were several other languages available. They have a lovely garden as well. The gift shop at the end was fun to browse in but the hand painted items were out of our price range. Nice tour that lasted about 1 1/2 hours.

title: Great place for a bike ride
text: We rented bikes and rode the paths among the windmills. Two of the windmills are open so you can go inside to see what they look like. Beautiful scenery. I would suggest you get there early as the tour buses showed up toward the end of our time there and it became quite crowded. You can get there by water taxi from Rotterdam.
